comments:
The following error has been caught by our crash detection tools. I do not have any further context beyond this stack trace. Hopefully it's just a matter of adding an extra check somewhere.

java.io.FileNotFoundException: JAR entry META-INF/taglib.tld not found in D:\workspaces\contentui\.metadata\.plugins\com.bea.workshop.wls.core\libraries\content-management-app-lib_10.0.0_10.0.0\1\content.jar
	at sun.net.www.protocol.jar.JarURLConnection.connect(JarURLConnection.java:114)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.jar.JarURLConnection.getInputStream(JarURLConnection.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.ProjectDescription.restoreReferences(ProjectDescription.java:1448)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.ProjectDescription.<init>(ProjectDescription.java:502)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex.createDescription(TaglibIndex.java:643)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:120)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsp.core.taglib.TaglibIndex$ClasspathChangeListener.elementChanged(TaglibIndex.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor$3.run(DeltaProcessor.java:1458)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.notifyListeners(DeltaProcessor.java:1448)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.firePostChangeDelta(DeltaProcessor.java:1296)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessor.fire(DeltaProcessor.java:1271)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.run(JavaModelOperation.java:760)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.run(JavaCore.java:4024)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.setClasspathContainer(JavaCore.java:4198)
Konstantin, does D:\workspaces\contentui\.metadata\.plugins\com.bea.workshop.wls.core\libraries\content-management-app-lib_10.0.0_10.0.0\1\content.jar contain a META-INF/taglib.tld file?
Unfortunately, I don't have access to anything beyound this stack trace, so I couldn't tell you anything about this jar.
In that case I have to resolve this as WORKSFORME since I've never seen this before.  Please reopen if you can provide further details.

I am not going to argue (too much), but note that it's often the case that very little information is known about failures that occurr in the field. These failures compound to create general perception of instability of WTP that we keep hearing from both open-source product users and our product's customers. I guess my point is that if it's possible to get any information about this failure from the available information then that effort would benefit the entire community.

(In reply to comment #4)

I wholeheartedly agree, but I've checked the code which saves references and marks it so that the META-INF/taglib.tld file is present as well as the part restoring those references and it looks correct.  The other possibility that I could think of was that the com.bea.workshop.wls.core plug-in changed at some point so that the content.jar contents were changed, but there's no way for me to verify that.
